qas.question: Where do many modern day hunter-gatherers live?
In what type of climate do hunter-gatherers live?
What kind of human life-style is pushing hunter-gatherers out of their environment?
What has Jared Diamond blamed the decline of gatherers on?
What type of food animal went extict by the end of the Pleistocene era?
What groups have continually increased in numbers?
All large mammal species have gone extinct in what countries?
Because of overpopulation, most large mammal species have what?
Competition for land use results in which societies remaining where they are?

context: Many groups continued their <b5_0>hunter-gatherer<b5_0/> ways of life, although their numbers have continually declined, partly as a result of pressure from growing agricultural and pastoral communities. Many of them reside <a0_0><b8_0>in the developing world<b8_0/><a0_0/>, either in <a1_0>arid regions or tropical forests<a1_0/>. Areas that were formerly available to hunter-gatherers were—and continue to be—encroached upon by the <a2_0>settlements of agriculturalists<a2_0/>. In the resulting competition for land use, <b9_0>hunter-gatherer societies<b9_0/> either adopted these practices or moved to other areas. In addition, Jared Diamond has blamed a decline in the <a3_0>availability of wild foods<a3_0/>, particularly animal resources. In <b6_0>North and South America<b6_0/>, for example, most <a4_0>large mammal species<a4_0/> had <b7_0>gone extinct<b7_0/> by the end of the Pleistocene—according to Diamond, because of overexploitation by humans, although the overkill hypothesis he advocates is strongly contested.[by whom?]
